Key Match Events: Kyle Hendricks gave the Cubs six strong innings in a 6-2 win over the Rockies.
Jacob Stallings hit a leadoff homer in the third inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Kyle Hendricks expressed gratitude to the Cubs for their continued belief and support.
Craig Counsell highlighted Hendricks' adjustments and professionalism after a rough start to the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Hendricks became the first Cubs pitcher since 1995 to allow no more than one run and two hits in a start of at least six innings at Coors Field.
